ngiemboon: N ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé ngie ncù gẅie n ne ḿmaʼa é tʉ. M maʼa wɛ̌ ncù na twó sí, mbɔɔ na twó pʉ̀a Keleto pie ée Lawondise, mbɔɔ na twó petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Keleto tà ńgyɔ́ɔn pie é laa wɔ́ɔn gyá.
en: For I want you to know how greatly I am struggling   for you, for those in Laodicea,  # 2:1 Col 4:13–16; Rv 1:11; 3:14 and for all who have not seen me in person.

ngiemboon: N gÿo púʼu, lélɔg ńnéŋ ntʉ́m wɔ́b, nkwòŋe temte wɔ́b, mbɔɔ páʼ pɔ́ ge nyɛte zsé nò gie áa na Keleto, éfó mǒ é zsé ntsem Ssé gie à ka gÿo peg zsé, yɛ̌ ntsem gwɔ́ pɔ́ Keleto yé máŋwɛ́.
en: I want their hearts to be encouraged   and joined together in love, so that they may have all the riches of complete understanding and have the knowledge of God’s mystery  # 2:2 Php 3:8  #— #Christ.  # 2:2 Other mss read mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ; other ms variations exist on this v.,# 2:2 Col 1:27

ngiemboon: Azsénò ntsèm, mbɔɔ legye ntsèm pú ńgwɔ́ fùʼ gie á cúʼte ńdyeen pɔ́ na Yěsô.
en: In him are hidden all the treasures of wisdom   and knowledge.  # 2:3 1Co 14:6

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí mɔɔn menò ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ létó ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie mé neŋé ssé ńtáŋte, ésele twó gí.
en: I am saying this so that no one will deceive you with arguments that sound reasonable.

ngiemboon: N tsɛ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, tá nkwaŋá wɔ́ɔn tyé pɔ́ na pi. N ne ńkága á nue n zsě ngie pi ne ńtáŋte menò mí mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńkúʼte nò Keleto tà á tʉ.
en: For I may be absent in body, but I am with you in spirit,   rejoicing to see how well ordered you are and the strength of your faith in Christ.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ka kě ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô Keleto aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅi la, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie gẅi lenéŋè gwɔ́ páʼ à ne ńkwoŋo.
en: So then, just as you have received   Christ Jesus as Lord,  # 2:6 Eph 3:11 continue to walk in him,

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛte ńcʉŋ leŋaŋ sí pɔ́ na yé, ńtyé pɔ́ na yé páʼ ndá gie e tyé na cÿó la, ńne ńkẅiʼi ńkúʼte pɔ́ nò yé mboŋó, yɛ̌ nò ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mé la zíʼi gẅí. Pi cwóŋo ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé.
en: being rooted and built up in him   and established in the faith, just as you were taught,  # 2:7 Eph 4:21; Heb 13:9 and overflowing with gratitude.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn nyìŋ lélɔgɔ zsénò pʉ̀a mesoŋ gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ, éfʉte gẅí, pi gwe na lejÿɔʼ sé. Ayɛ̌ zsénò gwɔ́ pɔ́ cÿɔ̌nò gẅie é jʉ́ʼʉ na nùŋe pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgíŋe ńjʉ́ʼʉ na metʉ̀ mentí mentí mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, é té jʉ́ʼʉ na Keleto wɔ́.
en: Be careful that no one takes you captive through philosophy and empty deceit based on human tradition,   based on the elements of the world, rather than Christ.  # 2:8 1Tm 6:20

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn, á nue kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa na Ssé wɔ́ɔ, mé gyá na Keleto, yé gẅie à la sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: For the entire fullness   of God’s nature dwells bodily  # 2:9 Or nature lives in a human body in Christ,

ngiemboon: Pi lâ Keleto kéen ńtemte, e Ssé fó mǒ ńnáa gẅí fùʼ ntí ntí. Keleto ŋwɛ́ pǔ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin tʉ̀, ésáʼa njÿó.
en: and you have been filled by him, who is the head   over every ruler and authority.

ngiemboon: Pi lâ Keleto la gwɔ́ tà ńtemte, e Ssé gÿo liŋé na pi. Á gwɔ́ gie á nyɛɛ ngie pi ee pʉ̀a pé. À laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ńtsẅii mbwó pà Yúndà ngie pɔ́ gÿo mé púʼu wɔ́b, á gwɔ́ liŋé, táʼ, á ké ńgʉa na pi, mbà liŋé gie à gÿǒ na pi, á téen fóo mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ mbwó Keleto. Yɛ̌ liŋé ké těen fó na mefàʼ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ na lepuʼú wégè gẅie aa we Keleto, ḿbiŋe cʉa mǒ ńkẅile mmó gie á kɔ́ɔn ńtsóte wégè ńnéŋe na nò tepòŋ.
en: You were also circumcised in him with a circumcision not done with hands, by putting off the body of flesh,   in the circumcision of Christ,  # 2:11 Mt 1:17; Eph 5:2

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie mé la nuʼu gẅí tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, mé laa púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ḿbúte gẅí lâ Keleto ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, pi lâ pɔ̌ gíŋe ḿbúte ńzíme na legwé, á nue pi zẅǐŋ ngie e Ssé gie e la zíme Yěsô na legwé, à gẅiin tʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo pi zím gí na legwé.
en: when you were buried with him   in baptism, in which you were also raised with him  # 2:12 Eph 2:6; Col 3:1 through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.  # 2:12 Mt 17:9; Jn 5:25; 20:9; 21:14; Ac 2:24

ngiemboon: Pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, ńgwɔ́ mbwó Ssé, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mepfó, ńtí menò tepòŋ mí, mbɔɔ páʼ pi la te pʉ̀a pie mé la púʼu wɔ́b lélɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́. Á ké ńgwɔ́ na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà Ssé kéen ḿbúte gẅí lâ Keleto ńzíme na legwé. À kéen ḿbú ńdege menò tepòŋ mégè ntsèm, ńnáa mbwó pege.
en: And when you were dead in trespasses and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, he made you alive with him and forgave us all our trespasses.

ngiemboon: À la véle ŋwàʼne njǔ yeg lâ pɔ̌, mbà lepʉ̌ laa tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ŋwàʼne ńne sẅiŋe wégè na menò mie pege fʉate, ńgwɔ́ mé gɔɔn ngie à la pú wɔ́b Yěsô ńkime na tÿǒnkǐ, ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńcʉŋte ŋwàʼne.
en: He erased the certificate of debt, with its obligations, that was against us and opposed to us, and has taken it away by nailing it to the cross.

ngiemboon: E Ssé lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńgwoonte messé tepòŋ, é pie é gẅiin tʉ̀, ésáʼa njÿó yɔɔn, ńkẅile metʉ̀ mɔ́b ńgwáʼa, ńtéme shʉ́ twó pɔ́b mvfò láʼ. Á gwɔ́ páʼ à la lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo ngàŋatsǎŋ ncù, Keleto lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgwá ńgiŋ ńdɔg ńdaʼte ngie à jÿǒ ncù.
en: He disarmed the rulers and authorities and disgraced them publicly; he triumphed over them in him.  ,# 2:15 Lk 10:18; Jn 12:31; 16:11; Eph 6:12; Heb 2:14

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie tà pi cʉ́ʼ nyìŋ ŋaga gẅí na nò mmó mpfɛ̌ kà ye nu nǔ wɔ́ɔ, kà na nò melínɔ̀ɔn pà Yúndà wɔ́ɔ, kà na línɔ̀ɔn saŋ sẅé wɔ́ɔ, kà na melyɛʼɛ́ nzse Ssé wɔ́ɔ.
en: Therefore, don’t let anyone judge   you in regard to food and drink  # 2:16 Jn 6:55; Rm 14:3,17; 1Co 8:4; Heb 9:10 or in the matter of a festival or a new moon  # 2:16 Ps 81:3 or a Sabbath day.  # 2:16 Or or sabbaths

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ shúm lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ shúm sie é ne ńtóo. Mé ge gÿo gyá Keleto, é zsé ngie mé gyǎ kwàʼ sɛ̌ shúm.
en: These are a shadow   of what was to come;  # 2:17 Rm 8:38 the substance is  # 2:17 Or substance belongs to Christ.  # 2:17 Gl 3:24; 5:2

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ḿbaba gẅí, pi pyé ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ ncù gẅie Keleto la jÿó ńná né pi. N gɔɔn pʉ̀a pie é gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ná mbùm yɔb ssé tɛʼ, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é guʼte mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé. Pɔ́ gíŋe ńdɔg shúm sie pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie e Ssé nyɛ̌ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́b pɔ́ gyá, ńdɔg ńŋáʼte sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ. Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gẅiin pɔ́ nkwaŋá pʉ̀a mesoŋ, é gÿo pɔ́ zẅíŋ pɔ́ móm.
en: Let no one condemn   you  # 2:18 1Co 9:24; Php 3:14 by delighting in ascetic practices  # 2:18 Col 3:12 and the worship of angels, claiming access to a visionary realm. Such people are inflated  # 2:18 1Co 4:6 by empty notions of their unspiritual  # 2:18 Lit fleshly mind.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té ne ńkẅiʼi ńdaa nnɛ́ na Keleto gẅie yé zɔɔ twó wɔ́. Tá mbà twó zɔ̌ náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ge kẅéte mbùm nnɛ́. Atwó zɔ̌ gÿo mejwoŋó nnɛ́ mbɔɔ menŋàŋ nnɛ́ cúʼte ńkúʼte mbùm nnɛ́, é gúʼ páʼ e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo.
en: They don’t hold on to the head, from whom the whole body,   nourished and held together by its ligaments and tendons, grows with growth from God.

ngiemboon: Pi lâ Keleto la pú ńkwé, á lɔgɔ púʼu, ńkẅé gẅí mbwó metʉ̀ nzěm mie é sáʼa njÿó. Mélàʼakɔ́ mé gíŋe shwóŋo gẅí ngie tsɔ́ shúm ée shúm sie nzse ée mǒ tà pi zẅíʼte páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie pi gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pʉ̀a yɔɔn njÿó?
en: If you died with Christ   to the elements of this world, why do you live as if you still belonged to the world? Why do you submit to regulations:

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn páʼ mé gɔɔn ngie: «Tà pi jÿó tsɔ́ shúm léjÿó, tà pi zẅíʼ mbɔɔ zẅǐʼ, tà pi záb mbɔɔ pwó mǒ.»
en: “Don’t handle, don’t taste, don’t touch”?

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menzsè ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ na shúm sie mé jÿó é mag mag, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnéŋe ssé ńkwaŋte ńzáb.
en: All these regulations refer to what is destined to perish by being used up; they are human commands and doctrines.

ngiemboon: Mé tyé ńgyá mɛ̌ menzsè mie mé zse, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie ée mbòŋ la, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńzse, é gwɔ́ ye ntí lélɔg ńnyɛte ńguʼte Ssé, à ná nnɛ́ ssé tɛʼ, ńnyɛ mbùm ye ngɔ́ʼ tɛʼ. Tá mɛ̌ menzsè, ngwɔ́ é le kẅéte wégè lékúʼte ntʉ́m tà nkwaŋá tepòŋ lâ tsɔ́ ńtí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm é le gwɔ́ tsoló wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Although these have a reputation for wisdom   by promoting self-made religion, false humility, and severe treatment of the body, they are not of any value in curbing self-indulgence.  # 2:23 Lit value against indulgence of the flesh,# 2:23 1Tm 4:8
